name: Eldritch Name Generator
description: Unleash the ancient, unknowable power of names that whisper from beyond the veil! Craft monikers dripping with cosmic horror and arcane mystery. Perfect for your next RPG character, occult organization, or just to add a touch of the delightfully dreadful to your day.
introduction: Dare to delve into the forgotten lore of names! This generator draws upon a wellspring of eldritch influences, from Lovecraftian horrors to forgotten gods. Prepare to be amazed (and perhaps a little terrified) by the names it conjures.
howToUse: Click the 'Generate' button. If you dare...
Behold the unholy name that appears before you!
Copy the name and unleash it upon the world (or your next D&D campaign).
If the name doesn't quite send shivers down your spine, click 'Generate' again. The abyss awaits...

faqs.question: What exactly *is* an 'eldritch' name?
faqs.answer: Think ancient, mysterious, and slightly unsettling. Names that sound like they belong to entities from beyond human comprehension – or at least, from a really creepy book.

faqs.question: Can I use these names for my Cthulhu RPG character?
faqs.answer: Absolutely! That's precisely the kind of madness this generator was made for. Go forth and drive your fellow players insane with perfectly unsettling nomenclature.

faqs.question: Are these names actually real?
faqs.answer: Define 'real'! They're inspired by real words, myths, and a healthy dose of imaginative horror. So, while you won't find them in the phone book, they possess a certain... authenticity.

faqs.question: Will using these names summon unspeakable horrors?
faqs.answer: Probably not. But we're not responsible if something tentacled shows up at your doorstep. Use with caution (and maybe have a sanity check handy).

faqs.question: Can I suggest prefixes or suffixes for the generator?
faqs.answer: We're always open to expanding our collection of cosmic horrors! Feel free to send your suggestions our way. The more the merrier (and the more terrifying)!

faqs.question: My generated name sounds silly, not scary! What gives?
faqs.answer: Even the Old Ones have a sense of humor... sometimes. Keep generating! The perfect blend of terrifying and awesome is out there waiting to be discovered.
